ReinSeghalXSec configuration [Rein-Seghal Model RES xsec = Integral {BreitWigner(W) * (d^2xsec/dQ^2 dW)} {dW*dQ^2}
The actual Rein-Seghal model is coded at ReinSeghalPartialXSec.
This algorithm uses RSPXSecSingleRes to decide which instance of the ReinSeghalPartialXSec algorithm to run depending on the initial state: 1) CC (n+p), 2) NC (n), 3) NC (p).
Note that in the pre-configured instances of various BreitWignerI instances that can be found in the algorithm factory, the parameter set is defined as "resonance_name"-"configuration-set". Below, you only need to specify the configuration set (use the breit-wigner-param-set-suffix key) as the resonance name is extracted from the interaction parameters and is appended to the key.
From this XML config file you can select: a) the actual differential cross section algorithm b) the baryon resonance parameter set c) the breit-wigner distribution algorithm d) the integration algorithm and the integration step e) you can narrow the physically allowed kinematic integration range f) you can decide whether to weight with the Breit-Wigner distribution or not
